intro: Tococa bolivarensis, commonly known as the Andean tea plant, is a shrub native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves that are used to make traditional herbal teas. The plant typically grows at elevations between 2,000 and 4,000 meters, thriving in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are rich in bioactive compounds, including polyphenols and caffeine, contributing to its medicinal and stimulant properties. Tococa bolivarensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal, with small white flowers that bloom during the warmer months.
